kodkod.cli

Class KodkodFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • kodkod.cli.KodkodFactory

  • public final class KodkodFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a set of methods that wrap Kodkod's AST, bounds, and options construction methods. The wrappers intercept all runtime exceptions thrown by the wrapped methods, and re-throw them as action exceptions for better error reports.

    • Method Detail

      • baseOptions

        public static final Options baseOptions()
        Returns a fresh options object with all default options, except for the reporter, which is set to a KodkodReporter that logs its messages to the global logger. Classes in this package should use this method rather than Options constructor to create new options instances.
        Returns:
        some o: Options | o.reporter.logger = Logger.getGlobal() && o.reporter.logger.level = Level.SEVERE

      • level

        public static final java.util.logging.Level level(int verbosity)
        Translates a Kodkod verbosity parameter into a corresponding logging Level. Verbosity values [0..Integer.MAX_VALUE] correspond to logger levels as follows: 0 = no messages; 1 = only error/severe messages; 2 = warning messages; 3 = info messages; 4/5/6 = fine/finer/finest messages; and >6 = all messages.
        Returns:
        Level correponding to the given verbosity

      • valueOf

        public static final TupleSet valueOf(Relation r,
                                     Bounds bounds)
        Returns the exact bound for the given relation, as specified by the given bounds.
        Returns:
        bounds.lowerBound[r]

      • valueOf

        public static final TupleSet valueOf(Expression c,
                                     Bounds bounds)
        Returns the tupleset representation of the given constant expression with respect to the given bounds.
        Returns:
        the tupleset representation of the given constant expression with respect to the given bounds.

      • compose

        public static final TupleSet compose(ExprOperator op,
                                     TupleSet first,
                                     java.util.List<TupleSet> rest)
        Composes the given tupleset with the provided list of tuplesets according to the semantics of the given operator. The operator must be one of ExprOperator#UNION, ExprOperator#INTERSECTION, ExprOperator#DIFFERENCE, or ExprOperator#PRODUCT, describing the corresponding bulk operation on tuple sets.
        Returns:
        first op rest.get(0) op ... op rest.get(rest.size()-1)

      • union

        public static final TupleSet union(TupleSet first,
                                   TupleSet second)
        Creates a new tupleset containing the union of the given tuplesets and returns it.
        Returns:
        first op second

      • range

        public static final TupleSet range(Tuple start,
                                   Tuple end)
        Returns a freshly created tupleset that consists of all tuples with indices between the two tuples.
        Returns:
        this.bounds.universe.factory().range(start, end)

      • area

        public static final TupleSet area(Tuple start,
                                  Tuple end)
        Returns a freshly created tupleset that consists of all tuples in the region defined by the two tuples.
        Returns:
        this.bounds.universe.factory().area(start, end)

        public static final TupleSet setOf(Tuple t)
        Returns a fresh modifiable tupleset containing the given tuple.

        Adds the given tuple to the provided tupleset.

        public static final Tuple tuple(TupleFactory factory,
                                java.util.List<?> atoms)

        Returns:
        this.bounds.universe.factory().tuple(atoms)

      • declareVariable

        public static final Decl declareVariable(int idx,
                                         Multiplicity mult,
                                         Expression expr)
        Returns a declaration of a quantified variable "v"+idx with the given multiplicity and expression.
        Returns:
        Variable.nary("v"+idx, expr.arity()).declare(mult, expr)

      • compose

        public static final Formula compose(FormulaOperator op,
                                    java.util.List<Formula> args)
        Composes the formulas in the list according to the semantics of the given operator, and returns the result. Application of binary operators to more than two arguments results in a left-associative application of the operator to the arguments.
        Returns:
        Formula.compose(op, args)

      • compare

        public static final Formula compare(ExprCompOperator op,
                                    Expression left,
                                    Expression right)
        Compares the expressions in the list according to the semantics of the given operator, and returns the result.
        Returns:
        Expression.compare(op, left, right);

      • acyclic

        public static final Formula acyclic(Relation r)
        Returns the acyliclity predicate over the given relation.
        Returns:
        r.acyclic()

      • totalOrder

        public static final Formula totalOrder(Relation ord,
                                       Relation ordered,
                                       Relation first,
                                       Relation last)
        Returns the total order predicate over the given relations.
        Returns:
        ord.totalOrder(ordered, first, last)

      • compose

        public static final Expression compose(ExprOperator op,
                                       java.util.List<Expression> args)
        Composes the expressions in the list according to the semantics of the given operator, and returns the result. Application of binary operators to more than two arguments results in a left-associative application of the operator to the arguments.
        Returns:
        op.nary() => Expression.compose(op, args) else op.binary() => LEFT_ASSOCIATE(op, args) else op.unary() => args.get(0).apply(op)

      • comprehension

        public static final Expression comprehension(Decls decls,
                                             Formula formula)
        Returns the set comprehension over the given formula and declarations.

      • ite

        public static final Expression ite(Formula formula,
                                   Expression thenExpr,
                                   Expression elseExpr)
        Returns the if-then-else over the given formula and branch expressions.

      • compose

        public static final IntExpression compose(IntOperator op,
                                          java.util.List<IntExpression> args)
        Composes the int expressions in the list according to the semantics of the given operator. Application of binary operators to more than two arguments results in a left-associative application of the operator to the arguments.
        Returns:
        op.nary() => IntExpression.compose(op, args) else op.binary() => LEFT_ASSOCIATE(op, args) else op.unary() => args.get(0).apply(op)
